name: This quiz is "Totally Awesome"! | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Where does Charlie's family move to?
questions.explanation:
Los Angeles.

	Charlie's father, Mister Gunderson, was fired from his job. Thus, they are moving from Philadelphia to Los Angeles. Mikey Day played Charlie and Greg Kean played his father, Mister Gunderson.

questions.text: Who said the following? "Let's abraca-do this, people!"
questions.explanation:
Gabriel.

	Gabriel is the school janitor who secretly teaches a dance class. Dancing is forbidden in the town, due to a tragic event where kids danced so much that their feet became loose and detached from their bodies. Gabriel was played by Chris Kattan from "Saturday Night Live".

questions.text: Which one of these kids does not sit at the loser table?
questions.explanation:
Darnell.

	When he starts at his new school, Charlie is invited by Billie to sit at a table with the other losers, including a kid with a chronic nosebleed, a Jewish kid, and a kid who turns into a werewolf! The werewolf kid transforms and kills the school guidance counselor, with everyone cheering him on. Maybe he's not such a loser after all! Richard de Klerk played Nick, the kid who turns into a werewolf.

False.

	Gabriel, the school janitor, is actually thirty-five years old. He begins a romance with sixteen year old Lori. Lori was played by Dominique Swain.

questions.text: During Charlie's speech after he wins the decathlon, what does Mister Yamagashi keep saying?
questions.explanation:
"Asian".

	Charlie keeps referring to his teacher, Mister Yamagashi, as Oriental even though Yamagashi keeps correcting him by muttering "Asian". Mister Yamagashi was played by James Hong.

questions.text: Complete this quote from Darnell: "Have you ever broken a Puerto Rican dude's ___________ for sweatpants money? Then you can't be black!"
questions.explanation:
arm.

	Darnell was played by "Saturday Night Live" cast member Tracy Morgan. Charlie goes to Darnell to learn how to be cool and attract the ladies, but just gets a faceful of mace for his troubles.

Ben Stein.

	Ben Stein is a former speechwriter for Richard Nixon, and is a staunch Republican. Also an actor, he has appeared on "Win Ben Stein's Money" and "Ferris Bueller's Day Off".

questions.text: According to one character, what made the movie "Soul Man" seem like a good idea?
questions.explanation:
Cocaine.

	When Charlie visits Kimberly's house to try to woo her, he acts, dresses and looks like Darnell, who is teaching him to be black. Ben Stein's head appears in the corner of the screen and talks about 1986's "Soul Man", which was about a white man becoming black so he could get into Harvard.

Kimberly.

	Kimberly and Kipp are a couple, and both of them are the coolest kids in their respective gender. Kipp, who was ultimately eaten by Nick the Werewolf Kid, was played by Joey Kern and Kimberly, who ended up with Charlie's little brother Trevor, was played by Brittany Daniel.

False.

	The name of the high school principal was Picker, not Packer. Principal Picker tells Lori that dancing is outlawed and later tells Gabriel that it is okay to pursue a romantic relationship with the underage Lori.
